benchmark_details.name: AEGIS 2.0 (A Diverse AI Safety Dataset and Risks Taxonomy for Alignment of LLM Guardrails)
benchmark_details.overview: AEGIS 2.0 is a dataset designed to address diverse safety risks in large language models (LLMs) using a taxonomy of 12 core and 9 fine-grained risk categories.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To provide a comprehensive and adaptable dataset for understanding and moderating safety risks associated with LLMs.

data.source: Human annotations and LLM-generated responses to prompts from diverse sources.
data.annotation: Manual annotation by trained experts and automated labeling via a jury of LLMs.

methodology.calculation: Metrics are calculated based on majority voting from human and automated annotations.
methodology.interpretation: High scores indicate robust performance in safety classification tasks.
methodology.baseline_results: Models fine-tuned on AEGIS 2.0 outperform existing safety models.
methodology.validation: Model performance was validated through comparison with established benchmarks.

ethical_and_legal_considerations.data_licensing: The dataset will be released under a commercial-permissive license.
